name: Toybox.ActivityRecording.Session
docstring: Session objects control the FIT recording state machine.

parameters.name: name
parameters.docstring: The name of the Field as a String    * The maximum length may vary between products     * At least 64 bytes are available

parameters.name: fieldId
parameters.docstring: The unique Field Identifier for the Field

parameters.name: type
parameters.docstring: The type definition for the Field from the DATA_TYPE_* enumerator in the [FitContributor](../../Toybox/FitContributor.html) module

parameters.name: options
parameters.docstring: Optional parameters that can be specified for Field creation

dictionary_keys.name: :count
dictionary_keys.docstring: The number of elements to add to the Field if it is an Array    * This is also the maximum combined size of strings plus `null` terminators if the type is DATA_TYPE_STRING (Default 1)     * Apps are limited to 256 total bytes per message     * Data fields are limited to 32 bytes per message     * Messages larger than the limit will result in a "New Field out of memory for FIT data" error.

dictionary_keys.name: :mesgType
dictionary_keys.docstring: The message type that this Field should be added to    * Defaults to MESG_TYPE_RECORD if not provided     * If mesgType == MESG_TYPE_RECORD, DATA_TYPE_STRING cannot be used as the Field type.

dictionary_keys.name: :units
dictionary_keys.docstring: The display units as a String    * This should use the current device language     * The maximum length may vary between products     * At least 16 bytes are available

dictionary_keys.name: :nativeNum
dictionary_keys.docstring: If this Field can be treated equivalently to a Field that is included in the FIT SDK use this to indicate the Field Number that is specified by the FIT Profile.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.docstring: A reference to a callback which must accept two arguments.    * eventType: A TIMER_EVENT_* enum that describes the event that occurred.     * eventData: A [Dictionary](../../Toybox/Lang/Dictionary.html) containing data relevant to the timer event or `null`. If eventType is TIMER_EVENT_LAP, the following are provided if available:       * `:elapsedDistance` [Float](../../Toybox/Lang/Float.html) (meters)       * `:averageSpeed` [Float](../../Toybox/Lang/Float.html) (meters/second)       * `:maxSpeed` [Float](../../Toybox/Lang/Float.html) (meters/second)       * `:startTime` [Moment](../../Toybox/Time/Moment.html) (Moment)       * `:elapsedTime` [Number](../../Toybox/Lang/Number.html) (milliseconds)       * `:timerTime` [Number](../../Toybox/Lang/Number.html) (milliseconds)

name: Toybox.ActivityMonitor.Info
docstring: The ActivityMonitor.Info contains information about the user's current activity status.  The fields in this class may return `null`. It is recommended to `null` check a value before using it. If the value is not available, an error indicating that the symbol was not found will be thrown.

attributes.name: activeMinutesDay
attributes.docstring: The number of active minutes for the current day.  Contains the moderate, vigorous, and total accumulated minutes for the day. Value may be `null`.

attributes.name: activeMinutesWeek
attributes.docstring: The number of active minutes for the current week.  Contains the moderate, vigorous, and total accumulated minutes for the week. Value may be `null`.

attributes.name: activeMinutesWeekGoal
attributes.docstring: The value of the active minutes goal for the current week. Value may be `null`.

attributes.name: calories
attributes.docstring: The calories burned so far for the current day in kilocalories (kCal). Value may be `null`.

attributes.name: distance
attributes.docstring: The distance since midnight for the current day in centimeters (cm). Value may be `null`.

attributes.name: floorsClimbed
attributes.docstring: The number of floors climbed for the current day. Value may be `null`.

attributes.name: floorsClimbedGoal
attributes.docstring: The current floor climb goal. Value may be `null`.

attributes.name: floorsDescended
attributes.docstring: The number of floors descended for the current day. Value may be `null`.

attributes.name: isSleepMode
attributes.docstring: Determine whether the device is in sleep mode. Value may be `null`.

attributes.name: metersClimbed
attributes.docstring: The vertical distance of floors climbed in meters (m).  This only counts the vertical distance associated with the floors climbed metric recorded by the device. Value may be `null`.

attributes.name: metersDescended
attributes.docstring: The vertical distance of floors descended in meters (m).  This only counts the vertical distance associated with the floors descended metric recorded by the device. Value may be `null`.

attributes.name: moveBarLevel
attributes.docstring: The current level of the move bar between [MOVE_BAR_LEVEL_MIN](../../Toybox/ActivityMonitor/MOVE_BAR_LEVEL_MIN.html) and [MOVE_BAR_LEVEL_MAX](../../Toybox/ActivityMonitor/MOVE_BAR_LEVEL_MAX.html). Value may be `null`.

attributes.name: pushDistance
attributes.docstring: The wheelchair push distance for the day in centimeters (cm).

attributes.name: pushGoal
attributes.docstring: The wheelchair push goal for the day in number of pushes.

attributes.name: pushes
attributes.docstring: Wheelchair push count for the day in number of pushes.

attributes.name: respirationRate
attributes.docstring: Current respiration rate for the user, in breaths per minute Value may be `null`.

attributes.name: stepGoal
attributes.docstring: The step goal for the current day in number of steps. Value may be `null`.

attributes.name: steps
attributes.docstring: The step count since midnight for the current day in number of steps. Value may be `null`.

attributes.name: timeToRecovery
attributes.docstring: Time to recovery from the last activity, in hours Value may be `null`.

name: Toybox.Activity.WorkoutStepInfo
docstring: The Activity.WorkoutStepInfo class contain information about current workout.  This information can be retrieved with the [getCurrentWorkoutStep()](../../Toybox/Activity.html#getCurrentWorkoutStep- instance_function) or [getNextWorkoutStep()](../../Toybox/Activity.html#getNextWorkoutStep- instance_function) methods.

attributes.name: intensity
attributes.docstring: The intensity of the step

attributes.name: name
attributes.docstring: The name of the current step

attributes.name: notes
attributes.docstring: The notes for the current step

attributes.name: sport
attributes.docstring: The sport for the workout step

attributes.name: step
attributes.docstring: Duration and target information about the step

attributes.name: subSport
attributes.docstring: The subsport for the workout step. Currently only valid for breathing and swim workouts

name: Toybox.Activity.WorkoutStep
docstring: The Activity.WorkoutStep class contain information about current workout step

attributes.name: durationType
attributes.docstring: The duration of the workout step

attributes.name: durationValue
attributes.docstring: How long the step should last

attributes.name: targetType
attributes.docstring: The target of the workout step

attributes.name: targetValueHigh
attributes.docstring: The high value for the target range.

attributes.name: targetValueLow
attributes.docstring: The low value for the target range.

name: Toybox.Activity.WorkoutIntervalStep
docstring: The Activity.WorkoutIntervalStep class contain information about current workout interval step

attributes.name: activeStep
attributes.docstring: The step data for the active portion of the interval

attributes.name: repetitionNumber
attributes.docstring: The repetition number in the interval

attributes.name: restStep
attributes.docstring: The step data for the rest portion of the interval

name: Toybox.Activity.ProfileInfo
docstring: The Activity.ProfileInfo class contains information about the active profile.  This information can be retrieved with the [getProfileInfo()](../../Toybox/Activity.html#getProfileInfo- instance_function) method. Fields in this class may return `null` so should be checked for `null` values prior to use.

attributes.name: name
attributes.docstring: The profile name

attributes.name: sport
attributes.docstring: An Activity.SPORT_* enum value

attributes.name: subSport
attributes.docstring: An Activity.SUB_SPORT_* enum value. Can be `null`.

attributes.name: uniqueIdentifier
attributes.docstring: An unique identifer of the profile

name: Toybox.Activity.Info
docstring: The Activity.Info class contains information about the current activity.  This information can be retrieved with the [getActivityInfo()](../../Toybox/Activity.html#getActivityInfo- instance_function) method. Fields in this class may return `null` so should be checked for `null` values prior to use.

attributes.name: altitude
attributes.docstring: The altitude above mean sea level in meters (m).  Elevation is derived from the most accurate source: Barometer or GPS

attributes.name: ambientPressure
attributes.docstring: The ambient pressure in Pascals (Pa).  This returns ambient (local) barometric pressure as measured by the pressure sensor. The data is smoothed by a two-stage filter to reduce noise and instantaneous variation.

attributes.name: averageCadence
attributes.docstring: The average cadence during the current activity in revolutions per minute (rpm).

attributes.name: averageDistance
attributes.docstring: The average swim stroke distance from the previous interval in meters (m).

attributes.name: averageHeartRate
attributes.docstring: The average heart rate during the current activity in beats per minute (bpm).

attributes.name: averagePower
attributes.docstring: The average power during the current activity in Watts (W).

attributes.name: averageSpeed
attributes.docstring: The average speed during the current activity in meters per second (mps).  The average is computed as the elapsed 3-D accumulated distance divided by the elapsed time.

attributes.name: bearing
attributes.docstring: The current bearing in radians.  Bearing is the direction from your current location or position to the destination of navigation, dependent on your current location.

attributes.name: bearingFromStart
attributes.docstring: The bearing from the starting location to the destination in radians.  Bearing from start is the direction of desired track from the start of navigation to the destination in radians. This is only dependent on your location when a course is set, and it is not dependent on where you may have moved to during an activity

attributes.name: calories
attributes.docstring: The calories burned throughout the current activity in kilocalories (kcal).

attributes.name: currentCadence
attributes.docstring: The current cadence in revolutions per minute (rpm).

attributes.name: currentHeading
attributes.docstring: The true north referenced heading in radians.  This provides compass orientation if it is supported by the device.

attributes.name: currentHeartRate
attributes.docstring: The current heart rate in beats per minute (bpm).

attributes.name: currentLocation
attributes.docstring: The current location.  This member will always provide a `null` value unless the Positioning Permission is enabled.

attributes.name: currentLocationAccuracy
attributes.docstring: The current GPS accuracy.  GPS accuracy values range from 0-4. A value of 0 indicates an accuracy value is not available, while a value of 4 indicates a good GPS fix.

attributes.name: currentOxygenSaturation
attributes.docstring: The current oxygen saturation in percent (%)

attributes.name: currentPower
attributes.docstring: The current power in Watts (W).

attributes.name: currentSpeed
attributes.docstring: The current speed in meters per second (mps).

attributes.name: distanceToDestination
attributes.docstring: The distance to the destination in meters (m).

attributes.name: distanceToNextPoint
attributes.docstring: The distance to the next point in meters (m).

attributes.name: elapsedDistance
attributes.docstring: The elapsed distance of the current activity in meters (m).

attributes.name: elapsedTime
attributes.docstring: Elapsed time of the current activity in milliseconds (ms).

attributes.name: elevationAtDestination
attributes.docstring: The elevation at the destination in meters (m).

attributes.name: elevationAtNextPoint
attributes.docstring: The elevation at the next point in meters (m).

attributes.name: energyExpenditure
attributes.docstring: The current energy expenditure in kilocalories per minute (kcals/min).  Energy expenditure is a metric developed by FirstBeat that provides an estimation of the calorie burn rate calculated from heart rate data.

attributes.name: frontDerailleurIndex
attributes.docstring: The current front bicycle derailleur index.  Index values range from from 1 to the frontDerailleurMax.

attributes.name: frontDerailleurMax
attributes.docstring: The front bicycle derailleur maximum index.

attributes.name: frontDerailleurSize
attributes.docstring: The front bicycle derailleur gear size in number of teeth.

attributes.name: maxCadence
attributes.docstring: The maximum cadence recorded during the current activity in revolutions per minute (rpm).

attributes.name: maxHeartRate
attributes.docstring: The maximum heart rate recorded during the current activity in beats per minute (bpm).

attributes.name: maxPower
attributes.docstring: The maximum power recorded during the current activity in Watts (W).

attributes.name: maxSpeed
attributes.docstring: The maximum speed recorded during the current activity in meters per second (mps).

attributes.name: meanSeaLevelPressure
attributes.docstring: The mean sea level barometric pressure in Pascals (Pa).  This returns barometric pressure calibrated to sea level. Since pressure varies dues to several factors, a GPS-based altitude must first be obtained, then the ambient (local) pressure is measured by the pressure sensor before conversion to a calibrated barometric pressure value.

attributes.name: nameOfDestination
attributes.docstring: The name of the destination.

attributes.name: nameOfNextPoint
attributes.docstring: The name of the next point.

attributes.name: offCourseDistance
attributes.docstring: The distance to the nearest point on the current course in meters (m).

attributes.name: rawAmbientPressure
attributes.docstring: The raw ambient pressure in Pascals (Pa).  This returns ambient (local) barometric pressure as measured by the internal pressure sensor. The data is the temperature compensated information read directly from the internal sensor.

attributes.name: rearDerailleurIndex
attributes.docstring: The current rear bicycle derailleur index.  Index values range from from 1 to the rearDerailleurMax.

attributes.name: rearDerailleurMax
attributes.docstring: The rear bicycle derailleur maximum index.

attributes.name: rearDerailleurSize
attributes.docstring: The rear bicycle derailleur gear size in number of teeth.

attributes.name: startLocation
attributes.docstring: The starting location of the current activity.  This member will always provide a `null` value unless the Positioning Permission is enabled.

attributes.name: startTime
attributes.docstring: The starting time of the current activity.

attributes.name: swimStrokeType
attributes.docstring: The swim stroke type from the previous length.  Swim stroke type values range from 0-6. Each Number value represents a different swim stroke type (e.g. freestyle, backstroke, etc.).

attributes.name: swimSwolf
attributes.docstring: The SWOLF score from the previous length.  SWOLF is an abbreviation for Swim-Golf, a measure of swimming efficiency. The score is obtained by adding the strokes per length to the total time of the length. For example, if it takes ten strokes and thirty seconds to swim a pool length, the SWOLF score is 40. Just like golf, a lower SWOLF score is better.

attributes.name: timerState
attributes.docstring: The recording timer state.  The timer state ranges from 0-3. A value of 0 indicates that the timer is off and there is no active recording, while a value of 3 indicates timer is on and there is an active recording.

attributes.name: timerTime
attributes.docstring: The current Timer value in milliseconds (ms).

attributes.name: totalAscent
attributes.docstring: The total ascent during the current activity in meters (m).

attributes.name: totalDescent
attributes.docstring: The total descent during the current activity in meters (m).

attributes.name: track
attributes.docstring: The current track in radians.  Track is the direction of travel in radians based on GPS movement. If supported by the device, this provides compass orientation when stopped.

attributes.name: trainingEffect
attributes.docstring: The Training Effect score of the current activity.  Training Effect is a score developed by FirstBeat, which indicates an activity's level of effect on aerobic fitness. Scores range from 1.0 (easy) to 5.0 (overreaching).

name: Toybox.ActivityMonitor.History
docstring: A class containing information about the user's activity history.  The fields in this class may return `null`. It is recommended to `null` check a value before using it. If the value is not available, an error indicating that the symbol was not found will be thrown.

attributes.name: activeMinutes
attributes.docstring: Number of active minutes.  Contains the moderate, vigorous, and total accumulated minutes for the day.

attributes.name: calories

attributes.name: distance
attributes.docstring: The distance for the day in centimeters (cm).

attributes.name: floorsClimbed
attributes.docstring: The number of floors climbed for the day.

attributes.name: floorsClimbedGoal
attributes.docstring: Floors climbed goal for the day.

attributes.name: floorsDescended
attributes.docstring: The number of floors descended for the day.

attributes.name: pushDistance
attributes.docstring: The wheelchair push distance for the day in centimeters (cm).

attributes.name: pushGoal
attributes.docstring: The wheelchair push goal for the day in number of pushes.

attributes.name: pushes
attributes.docstring: Wheelchair push count for the day in number of pushes.

attributes.name: startOfDay
attributes.docstring: A [Moment](../../Toybox/Time/Moment.html) object representing the start time of the day recorded by this History object

attributes.name: stepGoal
attributes.docstring: The step goal for the day in number of steps.

attributes.name: steps
attributes.docstring: The step count for the day in number of steps.

name: Toybox.ActivityMonitor.HeartRateSample
docstring: A class containing heart rate data at a given time.

attributes.name: heartRate
attributes.docstring: Heart rate in beats per minute (bpm).  Before using heart rate information, check for [INVALID_HR_SAMPLE](../../Toybox/ActivityMonitor/INVALID_HR_SAMPLE.html) to be sure data is available.

attributes.name: when
attributes.docstring: The time of the heart rate sample

name: Toybox.ActivityMonitor.HeartRateIterator
docstring: A class containing heart rate data for a given period of time.

name: Toybox.ActivityMonitor.ActiveMinutes
docstring: A class representing the active minutes recorded by the device.

attributes.name: moderate
attributes.docstring: The total number of moderate activity minutes recorded by the device.

attributes.name: total
attributes.docstring: The total number of active minutes recorded by the device.  This value is equal to the total number of moderate minutes plus twice the total number of vigorous minutes.

attributes.name: vigorous
attributes.docstring: The total number of vigorous activity minutes recorded by the device.

name: Toybox.Ant.UnableToAcquireEncryptedChannelException
docstring: Thrown if the Encryption Manager's enableEncryption is unable to acquire an encryption channel either because there are too many encrypted channels or an error occurred while acquiring an encrypted channel.

name: Toybox.Ant.UnableToAcquireChannelException
docstring: Thrown if the [GenericChannel.initialize()](../../Toybox/Ant/GenericChannel.html#initialize- instance_function) is unable to acquire an ANT channel from the system. This indicates that all available ANT channels are in use.

name: Toybox.Ant.Message

attributes.name: rssi

attributes.name: timestamp

name: Toybox.Ant.GenericChannel
docstring: A class for controlling an ANT wireless channel.  The GenericChannel provides the methods necessary for initialization, life cycle, and encryption of ANT channels.

dictionary_keys.name: :deviceNumber
dictionary_keys.docstring: The ANT-id of the device to search for. Not setting enables a wild card search

dictionary_keys.name: :deviceType
dictionary_keys.docstring: 1-Byte device type identifier

dictionary_keys.name: :transmissionType
dictionary_keys.docstring: The manufacturer-specific transport type and extended device number

dictionary_keys.name: :messagePeriod
dictionary_keys.docstring: The message period that the sensor uses

dictionary_keys.name: :radioFrequency
dictionary_keys.docstring: The radio frequency that the sensor operates on. Range of 2 to 80.

dictionary_keys.name: :searchTimeoutLowPriority
dictionary_keys.docstring: The Low Priority search timeout that a receiving channel will wait for in order to start tracking a master    * Low Priority search provides the capability of searching for a master without interrupting other channels on the device     * Range of 0 to 12 (2.5s increments)     * Default 6 (15s)

dictionary_keys.name: :searchTimeoutHighPriority
dictionary_keys.docstring: The High Priority search timeout that a receiving channel will wait for in order to start tracking a master    * Is triggered after the Low Priority search mode times out     * Will interrupt other channels     * Will take priority over any other open channels on that device     * If it overlaps another channel the High Priority search takes priority and that other channel is blocked     * Keeping this search type disabled unless you have great difficulty acquiring a master through Low Priority search is recommended     * High Priority searches are disabled in data-fields, and will be ignored for that application type     * Range of 0 to 2 (2.5s increments)     * Default 0 (disabled)

dictionary_keys.name: :searchThreshold
dictionary_keys.docstring: A proximity threshold bin as a Number    * Configures the RSSI threshold a slave channel will search for which is effectively the distance at which a slave is willing to be from a master     * Values are 0 (disabled), 1 (closest), 10 (farthest)

dictionary_keys.name: :networkKey64Bit
dictionary_keys.docstring: 64 bit network key    * Set this when NETWORK_PRIVATE was chosen in the channel assignment

dictionary_keys.name: :networkKey128Bit
dictionary_keys.docstring: 128 bit network key    * Set this when NETWORK_PRIVATE was chosen in the channel assignment

name: Toybox.Ant.ChannelAssignment
docstring: A class to control the assignment of an ANT wireless channel.

attributes.name: channelType
attributes.docstring: Defines the type of channel.  The channel can be defined to primarily send data (master) or receive data(slave). The channel type is set via the CHANNEL_TYPE_* constant passed to the [Ant.ChannelAssignment.initialize()](../../Toybox/Ant/ChannelAssignment.html#initialize- instance_function) function for the `channelType` parameter.

attributes.name: network
attributes.docstring: Defines the type of network the channel should operate under.  The network is set via the NETWORK_* constant passed to the [Ant.ChannelAssignment.initialize()](../../Toybox/Ant/ChannelAssignment.html#initialize- instance_function) function for the `network` parameter.

parameters.name: c
parameters.docstring: The channel type specifier. Must use one of the following constants.    * CHANNEL_TYPE_TX_NOT_RX - Bidirectional Transmit (Master)       * Master Channels are not allowed on the ANT+ Network     * CHANNEL_TYPE_RX_NOT_TX - Bidirectional Receive (Slave)     * CHANNEL_TYPE_RX_ONLY - Receive Only (Slave)

parameters.name: n
parameters.docstring: The network type specifier. Must use one of the following constants.    * NETWORK_PUBLIC - ANT public network     * NETWORK_PLUS - ANT+ network     * NETWORK_PRIVATE - ANT private network       * A network key must be provided for an Private Network       * Both 64 and 128 bit keys are required

attributes.docstring: The simulated draft factor setting for simulation mode A draft factor of 0 removes all wind resistance, and 1.0 indicates no drafting effects.

attributes.name: slope
attributes.docstring: The slope (grade) setting of the simulated track

attributes.name: surfaceResistance
attributes.docstring: The simulated surface resistance coefficient for simulation mode. Dimensionless factor to quantify rolling resistance based on friction between bicycle tires and the tracker surface. Rolling Resistance [N] = (Bicycle Mass + Cyclist Mass) x Coefficient of Rolling Resistance x 9.8 Sample coefficients: Wooden track = 0.001 Smooth Concrete = 0.002 Asphalt Road = 0.004 Rough Road = 0.008

attributes.name: windResistance
attributes.docstring: The simulated wind resistance coefficient setting for simulation mode Wind Resistance Coefficient [kg/m] = Frontal Surface Area [m2] x Drag Coefficient x Air Density [kg/m3]

The [onSentMessage()](../../Toybox/AntPlus/DeviceListener.html#onSentMessage- instance_function) will be called to indicate sent manufacturer message status.

name: Toybox.Application.AppBase
docstring: AppBase is the base class for an app.  All apps inherit from this class and use it's methods to manage the life cycle of an app.    * Your app overrides the class to provide entry points with the following methods:       * [onStart()](../../Toybox/Application/AppBase.html#onStart-instance_function)      * [getInitialView()](../../Toybox/Application/AppBase.html#getInitialView-instance_function)      * [getGoalView()](../../Toybox/Application/AppBase.html#getGoalView-instance_function)      * [getServiceDelegate()](../../Toybox/Application/AppBase.html#getServiceDelegate-instance_function)      * [onSettingsChanged()](../../Toybox/Application/AppBase.html#onSettingsChanged-instance_function)      * [onStop()](../../Toybox/Application/AppBase.html#onStop-instance_function)    * These functions are called in the following order:     1. [onStart()](../../Toybox/Application/AppBase.html#onStart-instance_function)    2. [getInitialView()](../../Toybox/Application/AppBase.html#getInitialView-instance_function)    3. [onStop()](../../Toybox/Application/AppBase.html#onStop-instance_function)  Every AppBase object has access to an object store to persist data.

throws.docstring: Thrown if called from a background process

name: Toybox.FitContributor.Field
docstring: A Field records custom FIT data from an Application or Data Field to a FIT file on the device's file system.  Once a Field is created with the [createField()](../../Toybox/ActivityRecording/Session.html#createField- instance_function) method, you can submit the next Field value with [setData()](../../Toybox/FitContributor/Field.html#setData-instance_function), which will get written to the FIT file at the next opportunity. Depending on the device, writes to the FIT file may occur once per second or when new data is available (Smart Recording). Best practice is to only call [setData()](../../Toybox/FitContributor/Field.html#setData-instance_function) when values have changed to accommodate Smart Recording.  If [setData()](../../Toybox/FitContributor/Field.html#setData- instance_function) is called before the previous data is written out, the previous value will be lost and replaced by the current data. For this reason, we do not recommend using this feature for time-sensitive data requiring sub- second granularity.

parameters.name: input
parameters.docstring: The data to be written to the Field

throws.docstring: Thrown if the `input` type does not match the type specified in [createField()](../../Toybox/ActivityRecording/Session.html#createField- instance_function) at definition

name: Toybox.Graphics.BufferedBitmap
docstring: This class represents an off-screen bitmap. It provides methods to modify the bitmap palette, and get a drawable context.

parameters.name: options
parameters.docstring: Dictionary of options. Must contain width and height, with optional palette, or a [BitmapResource](../../Toybox/WatchUi/BitmapResource.html). This resource is not allowed to have an alpha channel.

dictionary_keys.name: :width
dictionary_keys.docstring: The width of the surface in pixels

dictionary_keys.name: :height
dictionary_keys.docstring: The height of the surface in pixels

dictionary_keys.name: :palette
dictionary_keys.docstring: The colors used in this surface. Using less will reduce the bitmap size. The bitmap will use the system default if not provided. The maximum palette size allowed is 256 colors. If a palette is provided, the number of colors must also be <= to the number of system colors.

dictionary_keys.name: :colorDepth
dictionary_keys.docstring: Color depth in terms of bits/pixel, when missing, default to system value.

dictionary_keys.name: :bitmapResource
dictionary_keys.docstring: A [BitmapResource](../../Toybox/WatchUi/BitmapResource.html) to initialize

dictionary_keys.name: :alphaBlending
dictionary_keys.docstring: A AlphaBlending enum to specify the level of alpha blending support for this buffered bitmap object

throws.docstring: Thrown if the palette size exceeds the number of system colors.
Thrown if the palette size exceeds 256 colors.
Thrown if the [BitmapResource](../../Toybox/WatchUi/BitmapResource.html) provided has an alpha channel.
Thrown if there isn't enough free memory available to load the resource.

parameters.name: palette
parameters.docstring: A palette for this bitmap. The number of colors must match the current palette. Each color in the image will be replaced with the colors specified in the new palette.

throws.docstring: Thrown if the palette size does not match the current palette.
